intro: Parasenecio ambiguus, commonly known as the ambiguous parasenecio, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with ray florets surrounding a central disc of tubular flowers. Parasenecio ambiguus is often found in alpine or subalpine environments, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
